item.title: Discrepancy in installs between Unity and Appsflyer reporting between March 5th, 09:48 UTC, and March 6th, 07:40 UTC.
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Unity Ads Postback Issue

On March 6th, 2024, Unity Ads experienced a postback issue with Appsflyer, impacting the attribution of in-app events and reporting. This resulted in a discrepancy in install numbers between Unity and Appsflyer. The issue has been resolved, and data restoration is ongoing. Please reach out to unityads-support@unity3d.com for any inquiries. Summary: Major incident affecting user acquisition and growth due to postback issue with Appsflyer.

Major incident - Growth, User Acquisition

March 6, 2024 · 13:26 UTC
Issue

We want to inform you about an issue that Unity Ads discovered with the postbacks received from Appsflyer between March 5th, 09:48 UTC, and March 6th, 07:40 UTC. This issue affected the attribution of in-app events and Unity Ads reporting. This can be observed as a discrepancy between the number of installs visible in Unity reporting vs Appsflyer’s reporting during this timeframe. Rest assured, we have resolved the issue, and we’re currently working on restoring the correct data. We will let you know once it will be restored.
If you have any questions please reach out to your Unity Partner or unityads-support@unity3d.com

item.title: Error creating a new trial subscription for DevOps
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - New Trial Subscription Issue

Summary: There is an ongoing issue preventing new trial subscriptions, but new DevOps subscriptions are working fine. Service is expected to be restored in a couple of hours.

Minor incident - Unity DevOps, Unity Version Control, Web

March 5, 2024 · 13:10 UTC
Issue

There is an ongoing issue that prevents new trial subscriptions. We are fixing the isssue and hope that the service will be restored in a couple of hours.

New DevOps subscriptions are working fine.

item.title: Unity ID/Login is unresponsive
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Incident: Unity Dashboard and ID/Login Unresponsive

Summary: On March 5, 2024, a major incident occurred, leading to unresponsiveness on id.unity.com, impacting the ability to sign in to the systems. The team is currently investigating to resolve the issue.

Major incident - Websites, Unity Dashboard, Unity ID/Login

March 5, 2024 · 10:42 UTC
Resolved

Service is back up.

March 5, 2024 · 10:25 UTC
Issue

According to our monitoring system id.unity.com is unresponsive, we’re investigating. This will impact signing in to our systems. Sorry for the inconvenience!

item.title: EventTimestamp UTC conversion resolution
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Minor Incident Resolved

Summary: An issue with event date conversion to UTC from player timezones via the SDK has been resolved, ensuring accurate reporting of player metrics. Some data over the next 24 hours may be slightly inaccurate as numbers settle. We apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience.

Minor incident - Analytics, Gaming Services, Data Collection

February 28, 2024 · 11:58 UTC
Monitoring

We’ve resolved an issue with event date conversion to UTC from player timezones via the SDK, ensuring accurate reporting of player metrics.

However, please note that data over the next 24 hours may be slightly inaccurate as numbers settle. We apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience

We’ve identified an issue which is currently affecting the Parsec Signaling Service. We are investigating this now.

item.content:encoded:

January 29, 2024 · 10:47 UTC

Legacy Analytics data injestion speed has been restored to its normal level.

Investigating

This is affecting Legacy UA1 Analytics.

We are currently experiencing slower-than-usual event ingestion speeds. Our team is actively working to address and resolve these issues to ensure normal operations are restored as quickly as possible.

During this period, you may notice delays in the processing and ingestion of events into our system. This could result in a slight lag in updates related to your account.

Parsec signaling service is currently experiencing a degraded performance with surge in activities. Engineering team is aware of the issues and is actively working on a resolution.

item.content:encoded:
Minor incident - Analytics, Gaming Services, Dashboards and Reporting

February 1, 2024 · 11:56 UTC
Resolved

We’ve been able to resolve the issue with the assistance of our data provider, and execution times are back to the levels we would expect.

You may notice an increase in the time spent on a query compiling in some cases, but be reassured that we only do billing on the execution duration, which have now been reduced to appropriate levels.

Issue

We’ve identified an issue causing analytics queries to take longer to execute than appropriate.
At this time we’re contact with our database provider to manage the issue.

There is no impact to data collection.

This is not affecting live builds, only the upload of new build images.

item.title: Parsec Extended Maintenance
item.content:encoded:
Minor incident - Parsec, Parsec API, Parsec Billing, Parsec Signaling Service

December 7, 2023 · 19:13 UTC
Post-mortem

Summary

During our planned maintenance window from Dec 4 10:00pm to Dec 5 02:00am EST, our team encountered unexpected database corruption issues that did not appear in previous testing. This unfortunately forced us to extend our maintenance from 02:00am EST to 04:00am EST. This caused our backend services and host connectivity to go offline for longer than we planned. If you have a host machine that still appears offline since this incident, we recommend opening and restarting the Parsec app on the machine, and contacting support if that does not immediately bring it back online.

Detailed incident report

The main purpose of the maintenance was to test our new multi-region redundant infrastructure, including cross-region database replication. We performed an intentional database failover from our primary region (us-east-1) to our secondary region (us-west-2). After doing so, our production MySQL database began reporting corruption of its internal transaction log that caused it to enter a continual, 30-second reboot loop.

After reverting the failover back to our primary us-east-1 region, the problem persisted despite multiple attempts at DB shutdown, recovery, and same-region instance failover. Unfortunately, our cross-region replication strategy also caused the corrupt transaction log to be replicated as well. Restoring a snapshot to a new database instance from an error-free timestamp also presented the same corruption issue. The east primary DB stayed in an unrecoverable crash loop between approximately 1:10am EST until 2:40am EST, when we found an alternate method to successfully force recovery on the primary database.

Support engineers from our cloud infrastructure provider have informed us that the underlying cause is a known, intermittent bug in MySQL 8 that can occur at high write loads and specific types of table indexes, such as Parsec’s table for maintaining the online status of host machines. After significant time with AWS engineers to diagnose the issue, we fully remediated by temporarily disabling a low-level MySQL feature related to InnoDB undo log configuration, dropped a high-usage database index that was triggering the bug, and then finally rebooted all primary and secondary database instances.

After the remediation at 2:40am EST, our backend systems gradually processed queued jobs and reconnection attempts until returning to normal levels around 4:00am EST. These systems include the REST APIs, WebSocket APIs and background jobs required for Parsec to operate. We continue to investigate how our database schema triggered this specific MySQL issue, and are also improving the high-volume database write and host reconnect strategies to avoid this happening again.

December 5, 2023 · 08:49 UTC
Resolved

We have confirmed platform stability and consider this incident resolved. If you are still seeing issues, please contact our support team.

December 5, 2023 · 08:39 UTC
Monitoring

We’re starting to see services recover and will keep monitoring.

December 5, 2023 · 07:12 UTC
Issue

Parsec is extending a previously scheduled maintenance window to complete necessary changes and restore service.

item.title: Parsec Maintenance
item.content:encoded:
Scheduled maintenance - Parsec, Parsec API, Parsec Billing, Parsec Signaling Service

November 30, 2023 · 21:36 UTC
Scheduled

Parsec will be performing scheduled maintenance on Monday, December 4th 2023. During the maintenance window we’re working on some key tasks that bring us a step closer to multi-region, fault tolerant infrastructure. This maintenance will also help lay the groundwork so future maintenance windows are shorter, more predictable, and can be planned for without disrupting the user experience. As this will be a heavier lift than previous maintenance windows we anticipate an extended period of downtime.

Maintenance Window By Timezone
Eastern - Monday, Dec 4th, 10:00 pm - 2:00 am EST
Pacific - Monday, Dec 4th, 7:00 pm - 11:00 pm PST
Central European - Tuesday, Dec 5th, 4:00 am - 8:00 am CET
Universal - Tuesday, Dec 5th 3:00 am - 7:00 am UTC

item.title: Unity projects cannot be created through public APIs
item.content:encoded:
Minor incident - Monetization, Websites, Unity Dashboard

December 14, 2023 · 11:31 UTC
Retroactive

We had a faulty deployment that made it impossible for new projects to be created through the public APIs. This affected our customers in monetization. The issue is now resolved and the fix is confirmed.

Minor incident - Growth, User Acquisition

Data has been recovered

item.title: Failures when downloading large log files via GSH
item.content:encoded:
Minor incident - Multiplayer, Multiplay, Multiplay API, Game Server Hosting (UDash), Clanforge

December 8, 2023 · 16:43 UTC
Resolved

Download timeout increased and bandwidth dedicated to file downloads has also been increased in order to mitigate issues.

November 10, 2023 · 12:54 UTC
Issue

Dear customer,

We have been made aware that downloading large log files via the Game Server Hosting (Multiplay) -> Servers -> {server} -> Logs page is subject to failure / timeout when the file is of a large enough size.

Our Engineering team have identified the root cause and a fix is in the works.

If you are having trouble retriving filesplease contact us via the usual Support page for assistance.

Once tested and deployed this post will be updated.
